channel.title: r/rprogramming - 최근 2시간 글

item.title: Just tried Meet Hour – surprisingly solid Zoom/Google Meet alternative (+ 10% off code!)
item.description:
Hey folks,
I recently gave **Meet Hour** a shot for video conferencing, and honestly? It’s kinda underrated. It’s got a clean UI, smart features, and feels like a nice blend of Zoom, Google Meet, and even a bit of Calendly all in one.
Here’s what I liked about it:
✅ **No Downloads** – 100% browser-based. Just click the link and go. ✅ **Secure** – End-to-end encrypted for private convos. ✅ **Custom Branding** – Add your own logo, colors, etc. to the meeting room. Super clutch for businesses and coaches. ✅ **Built-in Scheduling** – No need for extra tools – you can schedule, send invites, and set reminders. ✅ **Live Streaming & Recording** – Go live on YouTube/Facebook or record meetings with one click. ✅ **Interactive Features** – Whiteboard, polls, Q&A, hand raising – everything for engagement. ✅ **Handles Large Groups** – Works well for webinars, events, and big teams. ✅ **Affordable Plans + Free Tier** – There’s a free version, but the paid ones are really budget-friendly too.
🔹 **And right now they’re offering 10% off all plans** with this promo code: **MHAFDIYEmehchx5a**
I used it for a few client sessions and team calls, and the experience was super smooth. Might actually switch over full-time.
Anyone else using Meet Hour? Would love to hear your thoughts!
